summary.p: [1] When Sebastian Schertlin returned to Konstanz, he learned that Emperor Charles V had moved away from Magdeburg and was heading towards Halle because he had discovered that the [Protestant] forces were gathering at Magdeburg.
[2] King Ferdinand has taken leave of the Emperor and is heading to Bohemia.
[3] In Naples, up to 310,000 peasants have gathered.
[4] The Emperor is said to be recruiting troops again.
[5] Schertlin wanted to inform Bullinger and Mayor Johannes Haab of this and remains at their disposal.

div.p: My willing service and all the best beforehand. Gracious, dear sir, when I came here, I found that the Emperor, upon noticing that all the forces of our side were gathering at Magdeburg, turned away from Magdeburg and is heading towards Halle.
The Roman King has separated from him and is heading to Bohemia.
In Naples, the peasants are said to be gathered up to 310,000.
The Emperor is said to be recruiting troops again. May God grant all goes well.

I should not have withheld this from you, Mayor Johannes Haab, along with the expression of my willing services, nor have I wanted to hide it with my message. Given in Konstanz, on the day of John, in the year 1547. Schertlin, knight, signed.
To the honorable and well-learned Master Heinrich Bullinger, pastor in Zurich, etc., my gracious lord and trusted friend.
